newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's Samper names new secret police chief.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's Samper names new secret police chief.

text.p: Colombian President Ernesto Samper named a veteran National Police official on Friday to take over as head of the country's state security police.
Gen. Luis Enrique Montenegro, deputy chief of the National Police and head of a crack anti-drug force, was named director of the Administrative Security Department (DAS), a government statement said.

The appointment of Montenegro, 54, came a day after Jaime Cabrera, a former deputy justice minister and university law professor, resigned as DAS chief after holding the job for less than seven months.

No official reason has been given for Cabrera's sudden departure from the agency whose responsibilities include providing security for government officials, fighting drugs and kidnapping, and immigration matters.
Montenegro is the first police official to head the DAS since 1991, when Gen. Miguel Alfredo Maza Marquez was relieved of the post by then-president Cesar Gaviria.
